com.googlecode.csse460_2010.server
Class XMLParser

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.csse460_2010.server.XMLParser

public class XMLParser
extends java.lang.Object

XMLParser loads, read and parses the XML file. It also stores all the read data to avoid using memory for duplicate entries.

Author:
Christopher Rabotin

getWelcomeMsg

public static java.lang.String getWelcomeMsg(java.lang.String var,
                                             java.lang.Class cls)
Parses the serverWelcomeMsg to replace all the occurrences of variables with their actual value. This function is to be used when there is no instance of the class. No need to worry though, Java takes care of which of the two functions to call. Java rocks!

Parameters:
var - the first character of the variable ($ or @, etc.)
cls - the class which contains the fields of the text variables
Returns:
the parsed welcome message.

getWelcomeMsg

public static java.lang.String getWelcomeMsg(java.lang.String var,
                                             java.lang.Object obj)
Parses the serverWelcomeMsg to replace all the occurrences of variables with their actual value.

Parameters:
var - the first character of the variable ($ or @, etc.)
obj - an instance which contains the fields of the text variables
Returns:
the parsed welcome message.

loadNParseXML

public static void loadNParseXML(java.io.InputStream xmlF)
                          throws org.jdom.JDOMException,
                                 java.io.IOException
This function loads and parse the XML file xmlF. To parse it calls the methods parseServerConf(), parseAttacks(), parseDaemons() and parseRooms() (in that order).

Parameters:
xmlF - the XML file to be parsed
Throws:
org.jdom.JDOMException - if the XML is not properly formatted
java.io.IOException - if the XML file cannot be read

parseAttacks

private static void parseAttacks()
This method parses the Attacks, defined in the <Attacks></Attacks> element. Each <attack></attack> element defined the name, the damage and whether the attack is reserved for daemons. The parsed data is stored in the attacks HashMap where the key is the name of the daemon. This method also fetchs the default attack for each player, which is the attribute playersDefaultAttack of the second level <Attack><Attacks> element.

parseDaemons

private static void parseDaemons()
This method parses the Daemons, defined in the <Daemons></Daemons> element. Each <daemon></daemon> element defined the name, the health, the victory points and the attacks of each daemon. The parsed data is stored in the daemons HashMap where the key is the name of the daemon.

parseRooms

private static void parseRooms()
This method parses the rooms in server's XML configuration file. The rooms are in the <Rooms></Rooms> second level element. Each room is defined in an <room></room> element. Each room can have up to four exits, one in each of the following directions: up,down,left,right. In this method, we start by parsing the rooms. Once that is done, we parse the exits. That enables the XML file to define rooms in what ever order and to reference them (via the <exit/> element) in whatever order as well.

parseServerConf

private static void parseServerConf()
This method parses the server configuration defined in the <ServerConfig/> element. It stores the attribute port in serverPort, the attribute maxPlayers in serverMaxConn, the attribute name in serverName and the attribute restartTime in serverRestartTime.
